title: Authors and Citation
text: Alex Slavenko. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Slavenko (2024). EndoSim: Run simulations using AGPIP Endosymbiont Model. R package version 0.0.5.2, https://cesaraustralia.github.io/EndoSim/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {EndoSim: Run simulations using the AGPIP Endosymbiont Model},   author = {Alex Slavenko},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.5.2},   url = {https://cesaraustralia.github.io/EndoSim/}, }

title: Run simulations using the AGPIP Endosymbiont Model
text: EndoSim can installed running following code: {r} # install package GitHub require(devtools) devtools::install_github("cesaraustralia/EndoSim") details TBA

title: GPA species information — GPA
text: pest object defining life history green peach aphid (Myzus persicae). Can used run endosymbiont model GPA.bg_loss derived Barton et al. 2021 alate_penalty derived Barton et al. 2021 apterae_walk Placeholder alate_flight Placeholder fun_dev_apt fitted using fit_wang parameters Barton et al. 2021 fun_dev_ala fitted using fit_wang parameters Barton et al. 2021 fun_imi_neg fitted using fit_imi_barton describe constant immigration 5 adults background population fun_imi_pos fitted using fit_null describe new introductions R+ adult fun_emi fitted using fit_emi_thack describe constant emigration rate based Thackray et al. 2004 fun_temp_loss fitted using fit_supergaus parameters Barton et al. 2021 fun_rainfall_loss fitted using fit_rainfall_thack parameters Barton et al. 2021 fun_sen_loss fitted using fit_gompertz parameters Barton et al. 2021 fun_dens_fecund fitted using fit_bannerman parameters Barton et al. 2021 fun_temp_fecund fitted using fit_quadratic parameters Barton et al. 2021 fun_age_fecund fitted using fit_weibull parameters Barton et al. 2021 fun_alate_prod fitted using fit_alate parameters Barton et al. 2021

title: GPA species information — GPA
code: data(GPA)

title: GPA species information — GPA
text: object class pest; see pest.

title: GPA species information — GPA
text: Barton, M., Parry, H., Ward, S., Hoffmann, .., Umina, P.., van Helden, M., Macfadyen, S. Forecasting impacts biological control future climates: mechanistic modelling aphid pest parasitic wasp. Ecological Modelling, 457, 109679 (2021) Thackray, D.J., Diggle, .J., Berlandier, F.., Jones, R..C., Forecasting aphid outbreaks epidemics Cucumber mosaic virus lupin crops Mediterranean-type environment. Virus Research, 100, 67-82 (2004)

title: Counterfactual Simulations — counterfact
text: Run multiple simulations endosymbiont model different scenarios

title: Counterfactual Simulations — counterfact
code: counterfact(   Pest,   Endosymbiont,   Crop,   Parasitoid = NULL,   init,   conds,   modules = NULL )

title: Counterfactual Simulations — counterfact
text: Pest object class pest defining pest Endosymbiont object class endosym defining endosymbiont Crop object class crop defining crop Parasitoid object class parasitoid defining parasitoid init object class initial defining starting conditions simulation conds object class sim_conds defining simulation conditions modules list modules scenarios run, NULL (default) fixed FALSE

title: Counterfactual Simulations — counterfact
text: object class endosim_col; see endosim_col.

title: Counterfactual Simulations — counterfact
text: Uses endosim function run simulations endosymbiont model. basic null model always run, without modules. provided pest, endosym, crop,parasitoid, initial, sim_conds objects used parameterise simulation. modules list following arguments: vert_trans, hori_trans, imi, emi, para. argument logical vector, consisting either FALSE (fixed ), TRUE (fixed ), c(FALSE, TRUE) (run counterfactual scenarios module turned turned ).

what: An S4 class to store a crop's life history for the endosymbiont model — crop-class
title: An S4 class to store a crop's life history for the endosymbiont model — crop-class
text: S4 class store crop's life history endosymbiont model

title: An S4 class to store a crop's life history for the endosymbiont model — crop-class
text: name name crop heal_time Half-time days plant recovery endosymbiont infection sowing_date Date crop sown YYYY-MM-DD format emergence_date Date crop emerges YYYY-MM-DD format harvest_date Date crop harvested YYYY-MM-DD format carrying_capacity Function defining proportion pest carrying capacity based days emerging density Crop density (m2)

title: An S4 class to store a crop's life history for the endosymbiont model — crop-class
code: canola <- new("crop", name = "Canola", heal_time = 2, sowing_date = "2022-04-05", emergence_date = "2022-04-10", harvest_date = "2022-11-01", carrying_capacity = EndoSim:::fit_sigmoid(1, 0.1, 80))  canola #> An object of class "crop" #> Slot "name": #> [1] "Canola" #>  #> Slot "heal_time": #> [1] 2 #>  #> Slot "sowing_date": #> [1] "2022-04-05" #>  #> Slot "emergence_date": #> [1] "2022-04-10" #>  #> Slot "harvest_date": #> [1] "2022-11-01" #>  #> Slot "carrying_capacity": #> function (x)  #> { #>     output <- K/(1 + exp(-B * (x - M))) #>     output <- ifelse(output < 0, 0, output) #>     return(output) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa95f54b0> #> <environment: 0x559fa95f8630> #>  #> Slot "density": #> numeric(0) #>

title: Download SILO data — download_silo
text: Download weather station data SILO

title: Download SILO data — download_silo
code: download_silo(date, year, var, path)

title: Download SILO data — download_silo
text: date date download data YYYY-MM-DD format year year date var name variable download (e.g. max_temp, min_temp, daily_rain) path pathway output directory

title: Download SILO data — download_silo
text: raster selected weather data variable selected date

title: EndoSim — endosim
text: Run simulation using endosymbiont model

title: EndoSim — endosim
code: endosim(   Pest,   Endosymbiont,   Crop,   Parasitoid = NULL,   init,   conds,   plot = TRUE,   progress = TRUE,   vert_trans = FALSE,   hori_trans = FALSE,   imi = FALSE,   emi = FALSE,   para = FALSE )

title: EndoSim — endosim
text: Pest object class pest defining pest Endosymbiont object class endosym defining endosymbiont Crop object class crop defining crop Parasitoid object class parasitoid defining parasitoid init object class initial defining starting conditions simulation conds object class sim_conds defining simulation conditions plot TRUE (default) generate plots progress TRUE (default) print progress bar vert_trans set TRUE turn vertical transmission hori_trans set TRUE turn horizontal transmission imi set TRUE turn immigration paddock emi set TRUE turn emigration paddock para set TRUE turn parasitoids

title: EndoSim — endosim
text: object class endosim_mod; see endosim_mod.

title: EndoSim — endosim
text: Constructs endosymbiont model using provided pest, endosym, crop,parasitoid, initial, sim_conds objects. Pest species feeds provided Crop. Vertical horizontal transmission endosymbiont defined using functions Endosymbiont. Parasitism rates defined usined functions Parasitoid.

what: An S4 class to store a collection of simulations with the endosymbiont model — endosim_col-class
title: An S4 class to store a collection of simulations with the endosymbiont model — endosim_col-class
text: S4 class store collection simulations endosymbiont model

title: An S4 class to store a collection of simulations with the endosymbiont model — endosim_col-class
text: scenarios Dataframe defining modules active deactivated simulated scenario sims List objects class endosim_mod, corresponding row scenarios

what: An S4 class to store a simulation output — endosim_mod-class
title: An S4 class to store a simulation output — endosim_mod-class
text: S4 class store simulation output

title: An S4 class to store a simulation output — endosim_mod-class
text: pest name pest crop name crop endosymbiont name endosymbiont parasitoid name parasitoid start_date first day simulation YYYY-MM-DD format sim_length length simulation days vert_trans vertical transmission active hori_trans horizontal transmission active imi immigration active emi emigration active para parasitoid active pest_df data.frame pest population time pest_cohorts array pest cohorts end simulation para_df data.frame parasitoid population time area area crop (m2)

what: An S4 class to store a endosymbiont's life history for the endosymbiont model — endosym-class
title: An S4 class to store a endosymbiont's life history for the endosymbiont model — endosym-class
text: S4 class store endosymbiont's life history endosymbiont model

title: An S4 class to store a endosymbiont's life history for the endosymbiont model — endosym-class
text: name name endosymbiont fitness_cost Relative fitness cost R+ phenotype (0-1) fun_trans_eff Function describing temperature-dependent efficiency endosymbiont transmission plants fun_susc Function describing temperature-dependent susceptibility R- pests infection plants introduction_date Date R+ individuals introduced YYYY-MM-DD format introduction_n Number R+ adult individuals introduced (assumed alates)

title: An S4 class to store a endosymbiont's life history for the endosymbiont model — endosym-class
code: Rickettsiella <-   new(     "endosym",     name = "Rickettsiella",     fitness_cost = 0.5,     fun_trans_eff = EndoSim:::fit_custom(seq(0, 36, 4),       c(0, 0.6, 0.7, 0.75, 0.8, 0.8, 0.75, 0.6, 0.3, 0),       k = 4),     fun_susc = EndoSim:::fit_custom(seq(0, 40, 4),       c(0, 0.15, 0.3, 0.45, 0.6, 0.75, 0.75, 0.6, 0.3, 0, 0),       k = 7),       introduction_date = "2024-04-05",       introduction_n = 1000     )  Rickettsiella #> An object of class "endosym" #> Slot "name": #> [1] "Rickettsiella" #>  #> Slot "fitness_cost": #> [1] 0.5 #>  #> Slot "fun_trans_eff": #> function (x)  #> { #>     new <- data.frame(x = x) #>     y <- as.numeric(unlist(mgcv::predict.gam(mod, newdata = new))) #>     y <- ifelse(y < 0, 0, y) #>     return(y) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa78d4cb0> #> <environment: 0x559fa78da1c0> #>  #> Slot "fun_susc": #> function (x)  #> { #>     new <- data.frame(x = x) #>     y <- as.numeric(unlist(mgcv::predict.gam(mod, newdata = new))) #>     y <- ifelse(y < 0, 0, y) #>     return(y) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa78d4cb0> #> <environment: 0x559fa83bbac0> #>  #> Slot "introduction_date": #> [1] "2024-04-05" #>  #> Slot "introduction_n": #> [1] 1000 #>

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: Fits function returns proportion offspring destined develop alates

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
code: fit_alate(omega, z, W, V)

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: omega inflection point logistic regression z logistic regression gradient parameter W logistic regression gradient parameter V logistic regression gradient parameter

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: Fits logistic regression curve determine proportion offspring destined become alate adults, based function defined cherry-oat aphids (Rhopalosiphum padi; Morgan 2000; Parry et al. 2006) $$ \frac{z}{1 + e^{-W \cdot \left( \frac{\text{density}}{V} - \omega \right)}} $$

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
text: Morgan, D., Population dynamics bird cherry-oat aphid, Rhopalosiphum padi (L.), autumn winter: modelling approach. Agricultural Forest Entomology, 2, 297-304 (2000) Parry, H.R., Evans, .J., Morgan, D., Aphid population response agricultural landscape change: spatially explicit, individual-based model. Ecological Modelling, 199, 451-463 (2006)

title: Fit alate production function — fit_alate
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_alate(67.418, 0.993, 0.076, 300) plot(seq(0, 15000, by = 1), my_func(seq(0, 15000, by = 1)), type = "l")

what: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
text: Fits function returns scaled daily fecundity based population density

title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
code: fit_bannerman(D, p)

title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
text: D carrying capacity (inflection point) p rate decline fecundity

title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
text: Fits curve based Bannerman & Roitberg (2014) describe daily fecundity changes density: $$ 1 - \frac{1}{1 + e^{-p \cdot (\text{density} - D)}} $$

title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
text: Bannerman, J,., Roitberg, B.D., Impact extreme fluctuating temperatures aphid-parasitoid dynamics. Oikos, 123, 89-98 (2014)

title: Fit Bannerman & Roitberg function for fecundity — fit_bannerman
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_bannerman(10000, 0.0008) plot(seq(0, 15000, by = 1), my_func(seq(0, 15000, by = 1)), type = "l")

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: Fits curve using generalised additive model

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
code: fit_custom(x, y, k = NULL)

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: x vector numeric predictor variable y vector numeric response variable, length x k passed onto smooth term x. Default length(x) - 1

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: Fits generalised additive model (GAM) using mgcv package.

code: fit_emi_thack()

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
text: x population newly emerged adults

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
text: number emigrating adults

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
text: base emigration rate 20% newly emerged adults

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
text: Thackray, D.J., Diggle, .J., Berlandier, F.., Jones, R..C., Forecasting aphid outbreaks epidemics Cucumber mosaic virus lupin crops Mediterranean-type environment. Virus Research, 100, 67-82 (2004)

title: Fit Thackray model for emigration — fit_emi_thack
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_emi_thack() my_func(runif(10, 1, 100)) #>  [1]  2 17 12  3  0  9 10  6 15 15

title: Fit gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
text: Fits function returns value based daily temperature

title: Fit gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
code: fit_gaussian(rmax, topt, a)

title: Fit gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
text: rmax maxmimum rate optimum temperature topt optimum reproductive temperature width parameter

title: Fit gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
text: Fits Gaussian curve produce temperature scalar ranging 0 rmax: $$   r_{max} \cdot e(-0.5 \cdot (\frac{|x - t_{opt}|}{}))^2) $$

title: Fit gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_gaussian(1, 25, 3) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: Fits function returns mortality rate based inverse Gompertz survival function

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
code: fit_gompertz(delta, beta)

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: delta shape mortality curve beta rate decline

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: mortality rate function pass Endosymbiont model. Fits Gomeprtz survival function calculate mortality rate: $$ 1 - e^{\left(\frac{\delta}{\beta}\left(1 - e^{\beta \cdot \text{{age}}}\right)\right)} $$

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
text: Gompertz, B., nature function expressive law human mortality new mode determining value life contingencies. Philosophical Transactions Royal Society London, 115, 513-583 (1825)

title: Fit Gompertz survival function — fit_gompertz
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_gompertz(0.00188, 0.13) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit model for immigration — fit_imi_barton

code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_imi_barton() my_func(runif(10, 1, 100)) #> [1] 5

what: Fit Lactin model for development — fit_lactin
title: Fit Lactin model for development — fit_lactin
text: Fits function returns parasitoid wasp development rate based daily temperature

title: Fit Lactin model for development — fit_lactin
code: fit_lactin(epsilon, tau, lambda, Tupper)

title: Fit Lactin model for development — fit_lactin
text: epsilon development rate scalar tau development rate scalar lambda development rate scalar Tupper upper development threshold

title: Fit Lactin model for development — fit_lactin
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Lactin model for development — fit_lactin
text: development rate function pass Parasitoid model. Fits curve using Lactin model (Lactin et al. 1995): $$ e^{\epsilon \cdot T} - e^{\epsilon \cdot T_{\text{opt}} - \left(\frac{T_{\text{opt}} - T}{\tau}\right)} + \lambda $$

title: Fit Lactin model for development — fit_lactin
text: Lactin, D.J., Holliday, N.J., Johnson, D.L., Craigen, R., Improved rate model temperature-dependent development arthropods. Environmental Entomology, 24, 68-75 (1995)

title: Fit Lactin model for development — fit_lactin
Fit null — fit_null
text: Fits function returns 0 given input value

title: Fit null — fit_null
code: fit_null(output = 0)

title: Fit null — fit_null
text: output value return (default 0) x vector class

title: Fit null — fit_null
text: function accepts x returns value output

title: Fit null — fit_null
text: function pass Endosymbiont model can used nullify process. default output 0, therefore can used stand-process modelled function accepting input vector. However, output can changed different value (e.g., 1) required, long null process supposed return constant value.

title: Fit null — fit_null
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_null(0) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")   my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_null(1) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")   my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_null(0.5) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
text: Fits function returns scaled daily fecundity based daily temperature

title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
code: fit_quadratic(a, b, topt)

title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
text: coefficient 1 b coefficient 2 topt optimum reproductive temperature

title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
text: Fits scaled quadratic curve produce temperature scalar ranging 0 1: $$   \frac{\cdot x^2 + b \cdot x}{\cdot T_{opt}^2 + b \cdot T_{opt}} $$

title: Fit quadratic curve for fecundity — fit_quadratic
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_quadratic(-0.7611, 31.9847, 25) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: Fits function returns mortality rate based daily rainfall

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
code: fit_rainfall_thack()

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: x daily rainfall mm

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: mortality rate

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: mortality rate function pass Endosymbiont model. Fits curve using Thackray definition rainfall-induced mortality aphids (Thackray et al. 2004, modified green peach aphid Maling et al. 2010): $$ \text{{Rainfall Mortality}} = 0.026 \cdot \text{{Rainfall}} - 0.33 $$ mortality increases linearly daily rainfall increases 15 mm capped maximum 0.5.

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
text: Thackray, D.J., Diggle, .J., Berlandier, F.., Jones, R..C., Forecasting aphid outbreaks epidemics Cucumber mosaic virus lupin crops Mediterranean-type environment. Virus Research, 100, 67-82 (2004) Maling, T., Diggle, .J., Thackray, D.J., Siddique, K.H.M., Jones, R..C. epidemiological model externally acquired vector-borne viruses applied Beet western yellows virus Brassica napus crops Mediterranean-type environment. Crop Pasture Science, 61, 132-144 (2010)

title: Fit Thackray model for rainfall-induced mortality — fit_rainfall_thack
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_rainfall_thack() plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: Fits curve using Rezende model fitting thermal performance curves

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
code: fit_rezende(ymax, xopt, xmin, xmax)

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: ymax maximal value y xopt value x y = ymax xmin minimal threshold x (y = 0) xmax maximal threshold x (y = 0)

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: Fits curve using Rezende model (Rezende et al. 2019): $$   y = \begin{cases}   \cdot 10^{\frac{\log_{10}(q_{10})}{\frac{10}{x}}}, & \text{} x < x_{\text{opt}} \\   \cdot 10^{\frac{\log_{10}(q_{10})}{\frac{10}{x}}} \cdot (1 - b \cdot (x_{\text{opt}} - x)^2), & \text{otherwise}   \end{cases} $$ Optimal values (rate shift parameter), b (decline rate parameter), q_10 estimated based provided arguments.

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: Rezende, Enrico L., Francisco Bozinovic. Thermal performance across levels biological organization. Philosophical Transactions Royal Society B 374.1778 (2019): 20180549.

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_rezende(1, 25, 2.84, 32.79) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit sigmoidal curve — fit_sigmoid
text: Fits sigmoidal growth function returns value based day emergence

title: Fit sigmoidal curve — fit_sigmoid
code: fit_sigmoid(K, B, M)

title: Fit sigmoidal curve — fit_sigmoid
text: K upper asymptote B growth rate M time maximum growth

title: Fit sigmoidal curve — fit_sigmoid
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit sigmoidal curve — fit_sigmoid
text: Fits sigmoidal growth function produce value ranging 0 K: $$   \frac{K}{1 + e^{-B \cdot \left(x - M \right)}} $$

title: Fit sigmoidal curve — fit_sigmoid
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_sigmoid(1, 0.1, 10) plot(seq(0, 200), my_func(seq(0, 200)), type = "l")

what: Fit super-gaussian function for mortality — fit_supergaus
title: Fit super-gaussian function for mortality — fit_supergaus
text: Fits function returns aphid mortality rate based divergence maximum minimum temperatures development thresholds

title: Fit super-gaussian function for mortality — fit_supergaus
code: fit_supergaus(Tupper, Tlower, Piupper, Pilower, Psi, Chi)

title: Fit super-gaussian function for mortality — fit_supergaus
text: Tupper upper development threshold Tlower lower development threshold Piupper mortality rate beyond upper threshold Pilower mortality rate beyond lower threshold Psi survival breadth parameter Chi survival breadth parameter

title: Fit super-gaussian function for mortality — fit_supergaus
text: function accepts Tmax Tmin returns y based fitted model

title: Fit super-gaussian function for mortality — fit_supergaus
text: temperature-dependent mortality rate function pass Endosymbiont model. Fits super-gaussian function: $$   1 - e^ ( -\Pi_{\text{upper}} \cdot (\chi \cdot (\frac{T_{\text{max}} - T_{\text{upper}}}{\Psi})^2) -\Pi_{\text{lower}} \cdot (\chi \cdot (\frac{T_{\text{lower}} - T_{\text{min}}}{\Psi})^2) ) $$

title: Fit super-gaussian function for mortality — fit_supergaus
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_supergaus(32.79, 2.84, 0.00083, 0.00017, 7.66, 17.66) plot(seq(-10, 50, by = 0.1), sapply(seq(-10, 50, by = 0.1), function(x) my_func(x, x)), type = "l")

title: Fit third-order polynomial regression — fit_thirdpoly
text: Fits function returns third-order polynomial regression

title: Fit third-order polynomial regression — fit_thirdpoly
code: fit_thirdpoly(a, b, c, d, inv = F)

title: Fit third-order polynomial regression — fit_thirdpoly
text: coefficient cubic term (x^3) b coefficient quadratic term (x^2) c coefficient linear term (x) d constant term inv TRUE return inverse

title: Fit third-order polynomial regression — fit_thirdpoly
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit third-order polynomial regression — fit_thirdpoly
text: Fits third-order polynomial regression: $$ \cdot x^3 + b \cdot x^2 + c \cdot x + d $$

title: Fit third-order polynomial regression — fit_thirdpoly
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_thirdpoly(0.00001084, -0.0021, -0.0272, -0.0145) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: Fits function returns aphid nymph development rate based daily temperature

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
code: fit_wang(H, r, Topt, Tupper, Tlower, bound)

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: H development rate scalar r development rate scalar Topt optimum development temperature Tupper upper development threshold Tlower lower development threshold bound boundary width thresholds

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: development rate function pass Endosymbiont model. Fits curve using Wang model (Wang et al. 1982): $$ \left(\frac{H}{{1 + e^{-r \cdot (T - T_{\text{opt}})}}}\right) \cdot \left(1 - e^{- \frac{T - T_{\text{lower}}}{\text{bound}}}\right) \cdot \left(1 - e^{- \frac{T_{\text{upper}} - T}{\text{bound}}}\right) $$

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang
text: Wang, R.S., Lan, Z.X., Ting, Y.C., Studies mathematical models relationships insect development temperature. Acta Ecologica Sinica, 2, 47-57 (1982)

title: Fit Wang model for development — fit_wang

what: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: Fits function returns daily fecundity based cohort adult age

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
code: fit_weibull(K, iota, gamma, eta)

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: K fecundity rate scalar iota shape fecundity curve gamma scale fecundity curve eta locations fecundity curve

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: Fits curve using Weibull distribution describe daily fecundity changes adult age: $$ K \cdot \frac{\iota}{\gamma} \cdot  \left( \frac{\text{age} - \eta}{\gamma} \right)^{\iota - 1} \cdot e^{-\left( \frac{\text{age} - \eta}{\gamma} \right)^\iota} $$

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
text: Weibull, W., statistical distribution function wide applicability. Journal Applied Mechanics, 18, 293-297 (1951)

title: Fit Weibull curve for fecundity — fit_weibull
code: my_func <- EndoSim:::fit_weibull(58, 1.885, 5.953, 0) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: An S4 class to store initial population sizes for the endosymbiont model — initial-class
title: An S4 class to store initial population sizes for the endosymbiont model — initial-class
text: S4 class store initial population sizes endosymbiont model

title: An S4 class to store initial population sizes for the endosymbiont model — initial-class
text: Pest Array describing sizes pest cohorts developmental stage, divided R+ R- apterae alates Crop Numeric vector length 2 describing crop. First element proportion R- plants (usually 1), second element proportion R+ pplants (usually 0)

title: Create sim_conds — make_conds
text: Create sim_conds object conditions simulation

title: Create sim_conds — make_conds
code: make_conds(start_date, end_date, lat, long, path = NULL)

title: Create sim_conds — make_conds
text: start_date start date simulation YYYY-MM-DD format end_date end date simulation YYYY-MM-DD format lat latitude site decimal degrees long longitude site decimal degrees path pathway SILO weather data. null (default) data selected dates downloaded

title: Create sim_conds — make_conds

what: An S4 class to store a parasitoid's life history for the endosymbiont model — parasitoid-class
title: An S4 class to store a parasitoid's life history for the endosymbiont model — parasitoid-class
text: S4 class store parasitoid's life history endosymbiont model

title: An S4 class to store a parasitoid's life history for the endosymbiont model — parasitoid-class
text: species name pest fun_dev_para Function describing temperature-dependent development parasitoids fun_para_scal Function modify development rate fun_attack Function describing attack rate function temperature fun_handling Function describing handling rate function temperature introduction_date Date parasitoids introduced YYYY-MM-DD format introduction_n Number adult parasitoids introduced (assumed female)

title: An S4 class to store a parasitoid's life history for the endosymbiont model — parasitoid-class
code: Wasp <- new("parasitoid",             species = "Diaeretiella rapae",             fun_dev_para = EndoSim:::fit_lactin(0.13048, 7.64313, -0.01308, 35.47),             fun_para_scal = EndoSim:::fit_null(1),             fun_attack = EndoSim:::fit_thirdpoly(0.00001084, -0.0021, -0.0272, -0.0145),             fun_handling = EndoSim:::fit_thirdpoly(0.298, 0.0035, 0.000256, 1.395, inv = T),             introduction_date = "2024-04-05",             introduction_n = 5)  Wasp #> An object of class "parasitoid" #> Slot "species": #> [1] "Diaeretiella rapae" #>  #> Slot "fun_dev_para": #> function (x)  #> { #>     output <- exp(epsilon * x) - exp(epsilon * Tupper - ((Tupper -  #>         x)/tau)) + lambda #>     output <- ifelse(output < 0, 0, output) #>     return(output) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559f9cd132c8> #> <environment: 0x559fa554c6b8> #>  #> Slot "fun_para_scal": #> function (x)  #> { #>     return(rep(output, length(x))) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa71b2fa0> #> <environment: 0x559fa554c4c0> #>  #> Slot "fun_attack": #> function (x)  #> { #>     output <- a * x^3 + b * x^2 + c * x + d #>     if (inv)  #>         output <- 1/output #>     return(output) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa53f0ba8> #> <environment: 0x559fa554c0d0> #>  #> Slot "fun_handling": #> function (x)  #> { #>     output <- a * x^3 + b * x^2 + c * x + d #>     if (inv)  #>         output <- 1/output #>     return(output) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa53f0ba8> #> <environment: 0x559fa554bc38> #>  #> Slot "introduction_date": #> [1] "2024-04-05" #>  #> Slot "introduction_n": #> [1] 5 #>

what: An S4 class to store a pest's life history for the endosymbiont model — pest-class
title: An S4 class to store a pest's life history for the endosymbiont model — pest-class
text: S4 class store pest's life history endosymbiont model

title: An S4 class to store a pest's life history for the endosymbiont model — pest-class
text: species name pest bg_loss Background mortality (0-1) alate_penalty Relative fecundity penalty alates compaered apterae (0-1) apterae_walk Number plants per day visited apterae alate_flight Number plants per day visited alates fun_dev_apt Function describing temperature-dependent development nymphs destined become apterae fun_dev_ala Function describing temperature-dependent development nymphs destined become alates fun_imi_neg Function describing number immigrant R- alates fun_imi_pos Function describing number immigrant R+ alates fun_emi Function describing number emigrants among newly metamorphosed alates fun_temp_loss Function describing daily mortality due exceeding temperature thresholds fun_rainfall_loss Function describing daily mortality due rainfall fun_sen_loss Function describing daily mortality due senescence fun_dens_fecund Function describing daily fecundity function pest density fun_temp_fecund Function describing daily fecundity function temperature fun_age_fecund Function describing daily fecundity function adult cohort age fun_alate_prod Function describing proportion newly produced nymphs destined become alates function pest density

title: An S4 class to store a pest's life history for the endosymbiont model — pest-class
code: GPA <- new("pest",   species = "Myzus persicae",   bg_loss = 0.03,   alate_penalty = 0.5,   apterae_walk = 0.0005,   alate_flight = 0.005,   fun_dev_apt = EndoSim:::fit_wang(24.1, 0.152, 18.09, 32.79, 2.84, 1.8977),   fun_dev_ala = EndoSim:::fit_wang(24.1, 0.16474, 19.96, 33.17, 1.41, 2.2202),   fun_imi_neg = EndoSim:::fit_imi_barton(),   fun_imi_pos = EndoSim:::fit_null(0),   fun_emi = EndoSim:::fit_emi_thack(),   fun_temp_loss = EndoSim:::fit_supergaus(32.79, 2.84, 0.00083, 0.00017, 7.66, 17.66),   fun_rainfall_loss = EndoSim:::fit_rainfall_thack(),   fun_sen_loss = EndoSim:::fit_gompertz(0.00188, 0.13),   fun_dens_fecund = EndoSim:::fit_bannerman(10000, 0.0008),   fun_temp_fecund = EndoSim:::fit_quadratic(-0.7611, 31.9847, 25),   fun_age_fecund = EndoSim:::fit_weibull(58, 1.885, 5.953, 0),   fun_alate_prod = EndoSim:::fit_alate(67.418, 0.993, 0.076, 300)  )  GPA #> An object of class "pest" #> Slot "species": #> [1] "Myzus persicae" #>  #> Slot "bg_loss": #> [1] 0.03 #>  #> Slot "alate_penalty": #> [1] 0.5 #>  #> Slot "apterae_walk": #> [1] 5e-04 #>  #> Slot "alate_flight": #> [1] 0.005 #>  #> Slot "fun_dev_apt": #> function (x)  #> { #>     output <- (H/(1 + exp(-1 * r * (x - Topt)))) * (1 - exp(-1 *  #>         (x - Tlower)/bound)) * (1 - exp(-1 * (Tupper - x)/bound))/100 #>     output <- ifelse(output < 0, 0, output) #>     return(output) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa95f66d8> #> <environment: 0x559fa95ffc58> #>  #> Slot "fun_dev_ala": #> function (x)  #> { #>     output <- (H/(1 + exp(-1 * r * (x - Topt)))) * (1 - exp(-1 *  #>         (x - Tlower)/bound)) * (1 - exp(-1 * (Tupper - x)/bound))/100 #>     output <- ifelse(output < 0, 0, output) #>     return(output) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa95f66d8> #> <environment: 0x559fa95ff718> #>  #> Slot "fun_imi_neg": #> function (x)  #> { #>     return(5) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa8e93ac0> #> <environment: 0x559fa95ff600> #>  #> Slot "fun_imi_pos": #> function (x)  #> { #>     return(rep(output, length(x))) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa71b2fa0> #> <environment: 0x559fa95ff440> #>  #> Slot "fun_emi": #> function (x)  #> { #>     output <- round(0.2 * x, 0) #>     return(output) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa5ac1f78> #> <environment: 0x559fa95ff328> #>  #> Slot "fun_temp_loss": #> function (Tmax, Tmin)  #> { #>     if (Tmax > Tupper)  #>         max_comp <- -Piupper * (Chi * (Tmax - Tupper)/Psi)^3 #>     else max_comp <- 0 #>     if (Tmin < Tlower)  #>         min_comp <- -Pilower * (Chi * (Tlower - Tmin)/Psi)^3 #>     else min_comp <- 0 #>     output <- 1 - exp(max_comp + min_comp) #>     return(output) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa9c52a58> #> <environment: 0x559fa95fee20> #>  #> Slot "fun_rainfall_loss": #> function (x)  #> { #>     output <- (0.026 * x) - 0.33 #>     output <- ifelse(output < 0, 0, ifelse(output > 0.5, 0.5,  #>         output)) #>     return(output) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x559fa71a5240> #> <environment: 0x559fa95fed08> #>  #> Slot "fun_sen_loss": #> function (x)  #> { #>     output <- (delta * exp(beta * x)) * exp(-1 * (delta/beta) *  #>         (exp(beta * x) -
